description: Wearers of this ring often have an uncontrollable urge to eat a lot and very quickly.

name: Green Belt
description: I Am Legend! And you?

name: Shrub Cap
description: Who said doggies are our best friends? You must not have known about this hat, which will never let you down. The opposite, however, is not so certain.

name: Ethylettes
description: These epaulettes have been soaked in plant extract, which causes the wearer to become dazed but merry.

name: Island Chain
description: This necklace was renamed. "Archipelago Necklet" was considered too much of a mouthful.

name: Cape Rice
description: It’s a total Cape Rice!

name: Bawk Bak
description: This armor offers very good protection for at least one year. It looks particularly beautiful in the summer too.

name: Equal Espadrilles
description: These espadrilles used to be banned. The fragrance given off by the plants can cause feelings of hopelessness and self-destructive tendencies.

name: Conkman
description: A stylish hat usually favored by the wealthy. It is made from a specific type of plant fiber found only on Moon Island.

name: Possessed Bracelet
description: This bracelet washed up on Moon Island, along with some Possessed Epaulettes. It can now be worn on your finger.

name: Mushroom Soup
description: The best local mushroom soup bar none! In fact, it's the only one!

name: Mercury
description: A block of solid Mercury. Handle with care and keep away from heat sources.

name: Chrome-Plated Mercury
description: It is said that Chrome-Plated Mercury heals wounds. But maybe it's used for something else?

name: Sea Boowolf
description: If you're not afraid of the big, bad sea Boowolf, why don't you try to take a bite out of it? Careful though, apparently it's just as tough dead as it is alive.

name: Cherry Tree Wood
description: This wood is strong, healthy, and imbued with the delicious fragrance of cherries.

name: Sakura Wood
description: Pour some boiling water over the Sakura, think about the future; it's only the next second. Don't forget that pouring the tea into the mug while it's still cold changes the equilibrium of their stable worlds.

name: Death Cap
description: When prepared properly, this mushroom is less death and more "dddarn, that's good!"

name: Weenie Death Cap
description: Before cooking this mushroom, don't forget to pluck out all of its hairs.

name: Pumpkin
description: The Pumpkin is an edible plant of the family Cucurbitaceae, which can be eaten as a soup or mash. You can also put it on your head...

name: Crocodyl Scale
description: Hard and rigid, freshly harvested from a Crocodyl's back. Surely only a fool would try that?

name: Crocodyl Leather
description: Crocodyl Leather of very dubious quality. It's probably not worth very much.

name: Crocodyl Tooth
description: If you lose this one, you might find another will grow in its place.

name: Pirate Flag
description: A black flag bearing a skull and crossbones, which once covered the Nyl King's back.

name: Dandy Top Hat
description: The hat won from Crocodyl Dandy after a little Gobball race.

name: The Cardashians
description: They say that these cards once had luscious black locks and were mad about another card player, the Vwest, whispering sweet nothings like... “Oh Kannye! Kannye! Wherefore art thou, Kannye? Deny thy father and refuse thy name; or if thou wilt not, be but sworn my love, and I'll no longer be a Capulet!” So nothing too serious.

name: Slippyneedler
description: Make sure to hold it very tightly, or it will slip out of your hands.

name: The Croc'Odaille
description: A lightweight and easy-to-handle wand that makes precision work a breeze.

name: De Nyl Amulet
description: This charm won't bring you luck, it's just a piece of string with a feather and a bone. It's quite nice though.

name: De Nyl Cloak
description: A beautiful and extravagant cloak made from Crocodyl skin. Just what you need to complete your set!

name: De Nyl Boots
description: Beautiful boots made from Crocodyl scales. Perfect for the beach!

name: De Nyl Girdle
description: A Crocodyl leather belt with a nice skull buckle. Essential fashion for adventurers.

name: De Nyl Helmet
description: This magnificent headgear bears the skull of a famous Crocodyl who was said to cry real Crocodyl tears. We're tempted to believe that said tears were shed as its head was about to be removed from its body.

name: De Nyl Tooth
description: A razor sharp Crocodyl tooth set into a ring.

name: De Nyl Torso
description: With this armor you can finally attempt that "death roll" move you've often dreamed about.  Although it probably won't work, because you're not a Crocodyl.

name: Scaly Boots
description: A small pair of smart, scaly Crocodyl-skin boots. High fashion!

name: De Nyl Epaulettes
description: Aggressive epaulettes to satisfy your kamikaze cravings.

name: Nyl Flag
description: A cape made from the pirate flag from the Nyl boat.

name: Nyl Crown
description: An ornate carved wooden crown, set with jewels of the Nyl.

name: Nyl Epaulettes
description: Sharp and strong, ideal for improving your melee fighting.

name: Nyl Belt
description: Embellished with a lovely golden gem, this belt is ideal for jumping into the fray.

name: Scaled Armor
description: A heavy breastplate made of Crocodyl scales

name: Nyl Shoes
description: Made of teeth and scales, these boots can certainly be classed as protective gear.

name: Fang Ring
description: It won't improve your bite, but it will increase your healing powers.

name: Precision Helmet
description: Don’t be fooled by the enormous horn, this helmet is made to preserve your personal space, not for charging. Opponents won’t dare to come near you and your impressive horn.

name: Nyl Tooth
description: A monstrous tooth mounted on an Amulet.

name: Fanged Cards
description: Cards with a little bite!

name: Slippyneedle
description: A formidable Hand, ideal for distance attacks.

name: The Recssenette
description: Its hard-looking heart is as mighty as the power it wields. Handle with the utmost care.

name: Nyl Breastplate
description: An armor of impressive thickness that provides incredible protection during a fight.

name: Crococape
description: You’ve heard of the Batcape, we give you the Crococape! A few less gadgets admittedly, but still very impressive.

name: Pointy Leggings
description: Solid leggings bristling with crocodyl teeth.

name: Shamanic Egg
description: Here’s an intriguing Crocodyl egg... They say that it has astonishing properties and can heal serious injuries.

name: The High Hoist
description: A mast pulley, cleverly tied to make a belt. Will particularly appeal to sailors.

name: Sham Moon Tail-Cape
description: This heavy fur cape will keep you nice and warm in winter!

name: Sham Moon Feet
description: You've moved heaven and earth to get them, so don't complain now!

name: Sham Moon Hands
description: These would make for a lovely book weight on your shelf.

name: Sham Moon Pendant
description: A small pendant of carved wood, sculpted to depict Moon.

name: Sham Moon Headgear
description: Hasn't anyone told you you look just like a little monkey?!

name: Sham Moon Belt
description: The big monkey-fur belt is perfect for increasing your virility.

name: Sham Moon Epaulettes
description: You can't teach an old monkey how to pull faces. What's that got to do with it? Nothing whatsoever...

name: Sham Moon Torso
description: A breastplate that's perfect for dressing up as King Kong, right?

name: Monkey-Ring
description: Have you found a monkey who'd like a ring on their finger?

name: Monkey King Epaulettes
description: These epaulettes come from an ancient kingdom, and it's said they belonged to a Monkey King, an expert in martial arts and master of secret bō techniques.

name: Sham Moon Hammer
description: Following the example of the Moon Hammer, this weapon contains a surprising, magical power.

name: Sham Moon Hair
description: A clump of hair taken from Sham Moon.

name: Bow Meoviator Helmet
description: This helmet belonged to an Imp pilot who disappeared while flying over Moon Island.

name: Precision Charm
description: A strange little doll, hanging from a blue cord. It's very effective, nonetheless.

name: Planty Stem
description: Sap constantly trickles out of this weapon, which makes it sticky from end to end.

name: Planter's Puncher
description: An essential weapon for fighting off rebellious plants.

name: Pouch of Emeralds
description: A pouch with four emeralds of great purity... What could they be used for?

name: Moon Aegis
description: A shield of surprising efficiency, not due to its resistance, but its ability to improve its bearer's vision. Maybe it has something to do with the emerald eyes...

name: Otomai’s Pilgrim Shoes
description: It is said that Otomai’s pilgrims wore these shoes to travel the World of Twelve in search of treasures and creatures...

name: Otomai’s Scouts Greaves
description: Before visiting new lands, Otomai’s Scouts are sent on reconnaissance missions, equipped with these very greaves.

name: Fine Sänd
description: This fine sänd is highly prized by Gnat, the Meridia.

name: Little Shortbread Biscuits
description: This biscuits taste nothing like bread, more like sand...

name: High Priestess Boots
description: So that's what Sydonia was hiding under her big dress! With a bit of luck, you'll take the same shoe size.

name: Rooted Boots
description: Wearing such boots, you'll truly be at one with the ground.

name: High Priestess Hat
description: It may not look very impressive, but this crown of vines is a symbol of great power.

name: Awful Skull
description: The only reason you wore this on your head was to hide your ugliness with an even uglier face.

name: High Priestess Pendant
description: Is this jewel where Sydonia got her power? In any case, it gives off a lot of heat.

name: Grapulet
description: Don't eat this amulet! Its grape seeds are fake!

name: High Priestess Belt
description: This belt keeps you in shape by sticking loads of little spikes into your skin. Painful, but effective.

name: Grapedye
description: It's tempting to pick this stem hanging between your legs.

name: Vine Leaf Loincloth
description: This loincloth has a strong countryside smell. When was the last time you washed it?

name: High Priestess Epaulettes
description: These simple-looking epaulettes are actually very sharp around the edges.

name: Ivypaulettes
description: These vegetal epaulettes are effective, but don't forget to water them every three days and give them plenty of sunshine.

name: Plastrunk
description: Slightly rigid, this armor shows everyone which neck of the woods you come from!

name: Barrelring
description: With enough practice, this ring can take out corks just as easily as Chafer Teeth.

name: Drainacask Wing
description: This wing won't make you fly, but it'll show everyone you're not afraid of Shushus.

name: The Drainacasks
description: A Shushu-skin bag, now that's something that'll impress other adventurers!

name: Drainacask Blade
description: Forged in the fires of the Shustuft Crust, this blade will burn your hands, but it's worth it.

name: Skullring
description: This ring is satisfyingly powerful, but one question haunts you: who does this skull belong to?

name: Barrelhammer
description: This hammer is filled with wine, to give your opponents a nice hangover.

name: Sworden
description: This sword's pommel is made of wood, but its blade isn't!

name: Vine Leaf
description: Something to bring a decorative touch to your creations.

name: Red Fabric
description: Do not wash with White Fabric.

name: Drainacask Tail
description: A Shushu's power can be measured by the size of its tail. At least, that's what they'd have you believe.

name: Torture Machine
description: A perfect device for your little evenings with your friends.

name: Spectral Lamp
description: This lamp gives off a worrying ambiance, but if you turn it off, you'll be left in the dark.

name: Cuddly Bow Meow Fish
description: The Cuddly Bow Meow Fish is a variety of Bow Meow Fish that loves a good cuddle, hence its name.

name: Verbala Salt
description: Put enough of this in your food and your guests will be too busy trying not to throw up to hear the snide comments you keep making about them.

name: Burning Coal
description: I'll succeed where Iron didn't. I'm going to bleed this miserable world dry, and ensure my place as true master of the Burning Mine!

name: Sentimental Flower
description: There's a children's story that says that Jiva offered this flower to a baby to stop it from crying. Ever since, it's been traditional to pop one into newborns' cribs.

name: Gilbert Chestnut Wood
description: Gilbert Chestnut played the piano standing up; while this is just a minor detail to you, it has great meaning to me. What's more, he played it really badly because he couldn't see the keys.

name: Babezel Wood
description: This wood is so hollow you could put it on to keep warm on those cold, winter nights. However, that's nowhere near as cute as a real babez.

name: Amakna Truffle
description: Once, Artichoke Roots were called "Amakna Truffles", due to where they come from. Now, only the prettiest examples bear this name.

name: Gobball Horn
description: Sorcerers sell tourists these horns in powdered form to bring them luck. The problem is, it also attracts Gobblettes in heat...

name: Tofu Blood
description: About a hundred Moskitos were crushed to collect this blood!

name: Bow Meowcass
description: It's still got silky, soft fur... full of lice.

name: Bow Meow Tooth
description: You should be happy! You didn’t have to deal with its claws!

name: Cottonsock
description: When did you start dressing in your grandmother's clothes?

name: Coarse Souper-Glou
description: Souper-Glou is the ideal ingredient to assemble your items. You can get it as a reward for the level 6 to 20 Environmental Quests.

name: Basic Souper-Glou
description: Souper-Glou is the ideal ingredient to assemble your items. You can get it as a reward for the level 21 to 35 Environmental Quests.

name: Treechnid Leg
description: These legs still move to certain musical sounds. Put simply, you might get a surprise if you think you're Mika El Jacq-Son!

name: Coarse Steel
description: A solid structure for your products; however, you shouldn't expect any more from this steel.

name: Basic Steel
description: This steel is the most flexible of types of steel; in other words, not very flexible.

name: Coarse Essence
description: A vial with a mystic look, but which contains nothing but the essence of the most primitive of monsters.

name: Basic Essence
description: This essence contains monsters' souls, and can instill their power into almost all types of items.

name: Treechnee Barkskin
description: This is a type of skin, reinforced with wood, which covers Treechnees' bodies.

name: Basic Bracket
description: This bracket will help all your furniture hold on tight.

name: Coarse Fiber
description: Some people are made of a maternal fiber, and other people have this fiber.

name: Basic Fiber
description: This enriched fiber possesses great culture, seeing that's what it's made from.

name: Basic Gem
description: It still isn't the most precious gem ever, but it is pretty.

name: Basic Plate
description: Drop everything to leave and not come back.

name: Basic Spice
description: With this, your dishes could raise the dead in Astrub Cemetery, or your fallen teammates.

name: Basic Oil
description: On oil of the most rudimentary kind, as its name suggests. Did you really need to read this to be convinced of it?

name: Basic Handle
description: If you stack them properly, it seems it's possible to make a pile of wood out of them.

name: Morfor Horn
description: You could say that you needed the strength of Brutas to get this horn!

name: Treechnee Sap
description: Rising sap doesn't make Treechnees mad, unlike Twelvians.

name: Treechnell Leg
description: A very hairy but thin leg. When stroked, it keeps moving and seems to be full of life, which is a little disconcerting.

name: Googoo Feather
description: Googoo Feathers are almost as magic as those from the Royal Piwi. Almost.

name: Branchileg
description: Is it a branch? Is it a leg? No one really knows.

name: Bone Powder
description: Making powder by grinding bones; now that's a good old grandmother's recipe!

name: Tofire Skin
description: After preparing this great Tofire Skin, you'll be nothing but skin and bone!

name: Difficult Anchovy
description: You'll have all the time to ask yourself difficult questions while fishing for Anchovies. It's not like you have the choice, either.

name: O'liwood Mint
description: Chew this for extra-fresh breath.

name: Francis Premier Api Wood
description: Great Governor of the Belle Epoque, Francis died from mixing up Apis and Apiwood while tasting them. If you look closely, you should be able to see a few teethmarks.

name: Cheh
description: In old Sufokian, the word for barley is pronounced "cheh". So, when a Sufokian sees that, they say "oh, cheh."

name: Trombone Ore
description: You can still here the dreadful screams of this poor ore while hitting it to extract it... "TOOOOOT! TOOOOOOOT!"

name: Nogord Wungleezared Scale
description: A scale fallen from Nogord's back.

name: Dragon Epaulettes
description: Bristling with sharp spikes, these epaulettes give both classy and formidable style.

name: Dragon Armor
description: A heavy breastplate imitating the muscular torso of a Prismatic Dragon. A surprising effect is guaranteed.

name: Dragon Coat
description: A coat of amazing finesse, with a very special intertwining of Dragon scales.

name: Dragon Helm
description: Forged from dragon scales by a mythical blacksmith, this helm is formidably effective.

name: Dragon Shin Guards
description: Shin pads of high quality, highly prized by archers.

name: Dragon Amulet
description: An amulet with overpowered powers...

name: Dragon Seal
description: A small ring harboring a violent, beastly power.

name: Prismatic Bow
description: This bow of extraordinary quality has been shaped in a completely unfamiliar way. It's said that it was created by the magic of a dragon from the past.

name: Prismatic Ring
description: A ring which makes its wearer surprisingly resistant.

name: Prismatic Buckle
description: This belt, crafted from dragon scales, will give its bearer formidably sneaky skills.

name: Coat of Chain Scales
description: A robust leather reinforced with dragon scales, making it supple and strengthening its effects using the ancient magic which traverses the scales.

name: Dragon Slicer
description: Imitating the wing of a Prismatic Dragon, this particularly sharp axe will be an important ally in wild and epic battles.

name: Iridescent Necklace
description: This amulet is crafted from the claws and scales of an ultra-powerful dragon, thereby giving undeniable magical properties.

name: Mage Cape
description: A great cape, spotted with prismatic reflections which give powerful powers to its wearer.

name: Eggband
description: An egg-squisite ring.

name: Eggstplate
description: This breastplate was created by someone who wanted to be impenetrable, except on the inside.

name: Egg Head
description: This headgear's charm lies not in the fact that it makes you look bald, but more in the fact that you accept it.

name: Dreggon Boots
description: Despite the centuries, these ancestral boots haven't lost their main use: they're still great barbecue skewers.

name: Dreggon Cloak
description: Dreggons come together once a year for a style contest. The most ugly attire is thus abandoned, which explains how you ended up wearing this cloak…

name: Small Shell
description: Many knowledgeable people have tried to craft a material that is as solid as Dreggon Shells, but without much success, judging by this shield.

name: Pocket Belt
description: No, not as in a belt that you can fit in your pocket, but a belt with many pockets. That's far more useful.

name: Poached Cloak
description: Breakfast, anyone?

name: Poached Epaulettes
description: It's all in the cooking!

name: Pocket Headgear
description: This headgear is a pocket model. It's smaller and folds up in just a few seconds: all of it has been designed so it's easy to transport.

name: Foot Ring
description: The Foot Ring isn't big enough for you to put both feet in it.

name: Soft-Boiled Talisman
description: Its consistency will not reassure you as to its solidity.

name: Easandals
description: You'll feel easy wearing these.

name: Reinforced Shell
description: The inner membrane of this improvised breastplate makes it very comfortable for its wearer. You'll feel as clean as a newborn child at the end of the day.

name: Epaulettes Goh
description: Goh was a great leader among the Dreggons. That's what we think, at least.

name: Horringble
description: This is the kind of accessory an ineffective Dregger can wear.

name: Egg Ring
description: The Dregger's aim is to slip it on your finger. Knowing this, are you still so sure you want to wear it?

name: Necklayace
description: Learning is a lifelong experience. You're best starting as early as possible, because "lifelong" is indeed quite long.

name: Lasso
description: Leather Dealers have always been talented when it comes to finding unorthodox uses for items…

name: Nine Leggues Boots
description: These boots belonged to an Ogre who ate Dreggon children.

name: Draconic Hood
description: Power, terror, fear… You inspire many things in those who lay their eyes upon you.

name: Exploded Ring
description: As bright as an exploding star.

name: Spewn
description: You can use it to fight off you enemies or to eat some wholesome soup.

name: Future Belt
description: A great responsibility weighs on those who have information before anyone else. Don't tell anyone what this belt does!

name: Dreggon Amulet
description: This amulet from the Dofus Era will make all the difference in combat by protecting you from a lack of ambition. And hits to the throat.

name: Plastrong
description: It really is quite strong.

name: Karma Epaulettes
description: Rub the left epaulette and an evil genie will torment you for all eternity; rub the right one and a good genie will make your greatest wish come true. Or is it the other way around?

name: Dreggon Scale
description: This very solid scale is used to make many fabulous items. Brushes, bags, curtains, woodwork…

name: Dreggon Horn
description: This is used to make hat stands.

name: Dreggon Shell
description: This reputedly unbreakable shell ended up proving to be the exact opposite.

name: Small Dreggon Egg
description: This is an egg that hasn't yet hatched. It was cruelly snatched away from its parents.

name: Poached Eggs
description: Albeit of edible appearance and aroma, this is actually a poisoned resource that has ended numerous adventurers' lives.

name: Clover Chocolate
description:
These divine little biscuits go hand in hand with Clover Root Beer to really bring out those precious flavors and zests. Consume liberally. 
(Lasts 1 combat)

name: Imperial Whirly Wedding Ring
description: It's a... nice day for a... Whirly weddiiing! YEAH! You look more rock 'n' roll than Larsenus Wallace!

name: Imperial Whirly Ring
description: Who knew the head of the Whirlies was such a fan of jewelry? This ring glints subtly as he twirls in and out of rooms at swanky parties.

name: Imperial Whirly Boots
description: Goodbye, being turned away at the door for informal footwear; hello, Bilbiza's trendiest clubs!

name: Imperial Whirly Cloak
description: This cloak sparkles and shines all over to make you the most questionably dressed belle at the ball.  Grab a shiny breastplate and a golden amulet and you'll look even better than the Kwismas tree!

name: Whirly Helmet
description: You're finally ready to fight like a true soldier. Crawl Out! Erm, I mean FALL out!

name: Whirly Boots
description: Hard on the outside, their inside is lightly quilted with a soft lining that will tickle your toes while you're kicking butt.

name: Whirly Epaulettes
description: Why not take these on a whirl with your friends?

name: Whirligig Breastplate
description: This breastplate, which is supposed to protect the front of your body, was, in fact, made with a Whirly's backside, which is softer and more elastic.

name: The Helices
description: Once they've been planted into their victim, these daggers continue to turn, just to carve as much meat as possible off their prey.

name: Whirly Cards
description: These cards look so pretty and whimsical when you drop them from a height that some people refuse to play anything but 52-Card Pickup with them.

name: Silmawhirly Cape
description: This cloak was most welcome in places like an island that the world has forgotten, where the heat was unbearable for much of the year. Twirl gently near the sunbathers and they'll be eternally grateful.

name: Silmawhirly Breastplate
description: When the whirl is not enough... try going Royal.

name: Silmawhirly Boots
description: These shoes are so light and comfortable that the participants of Prancing on Ice swear by them!

name: Silmawhirly Ring
description: Apparently, anyone who puts this ring on will have the magical power to twirl gracefully down from a tree to the ground. It used to belong to a Sram, but its powers left him in pieces.

name: Silmawhirly Epaulettes
description: These epaulettes will keep you cool all day long - and let you play at being a helicopter! Wheee!

name: Silmawhirlfriend
description: A lovely amulet to add to your collection!

name: Whirlihog
description: It makes you feel like sleeping...

name: Whirly Sword
description: Finally, ten years of baton twirling classes will pay off!

name: Whirlwand
description: When used, this wand glimmers and glows with powers called forth from the swirling mists of time!

name: Whirly Belt
description: With this belt around your hips, you can twist and shout all night long! Why not change your name to Russell? Go wild!

name: Royal Whirly Crown
description: This helmet is covered in Whirly Seeds, which helps it fit snugly around heads of all shapes and sizes.

name: Plas'whirly
description: Such a whirly good time!

name: Businesswhirly Epaulettes
description: These epaulettes belonged to a rogue trader: Whirly Capone.

name: Whirligig Shell
description: It is disturbing how similar a dead Whirly and a dead Tofu are!

name: Whirly Fin
description: Some practical jokers stick this thing on their back to scare the bathers. What fun... until they get mistaken for helpless fish by the local sea monster, that is.

name: Whirlisphere
description: It looks like a baby space hopper, but in reality, it's used for much more serious things.

name: Imperfect Spice
description: This spice is used to make lovely little dishes.

name: Fragile Spice
description: This spice is used to make lovely little dishes.

name: Rustic Spice
description: This spice is used to make lovely little dishes.

name: Raw Spice
description: This spice is used to make lovely little dishes.

description: This spice is used to make lovely little dishes.

description: This spice is used to make lovely little dishes.

name: Mystical Spice
description: This spice is used to make lovely little dishes.

name: Eternal Spice
description: This spice is used to make lovely little dishes.

name: The Mussamulet
description:
Shark tooth necklaces are so yesterday...
This year, choose the Mussamulet!

name: Mollusky Breastplate
description: Too bad this breastplate isn't bigger, or else you could curl up inside it and chill on the beach all day, safe from harm.

name: Waders
description: The boots of choice for budding marine biologists, these Waders will help you blend in when standing in rock pools the World over.

name: Clammy Epaulettes
description: These epaulettes will keep you safe in any clamity, and they make your mussels look huge!

name: Molluskamulet
description: Choose a pretty shell off the beach, drill two holes in it, and you've got yourself a product. Tourists love this stuff!

name: Mussly Shovel
description: Very useful for opening mumussels without hurting yourself.

name: Mollusky Miter
description: WAIT! Before you put this hat on, know that it's forever. Unless, of course, you're interested in ripping all your hair out trying to get it off.

name: Kralapace
description: This gloopy breastplate sticks fast to your skin and is known to give 65% of wearers allergic reactions! So that's why it was half price...

name: Epshellettes
description: With these sailor-made epaulettes on your shoulders, you look very whelk-to-do indeed.

name: Kralamulet
description: This tentacular amulet can cure certain illnesses, most notably sea sickness and sea food poisoning!

name: Kralaring
description: Plop... it's in the water...

name: Soft Embroidered Boots
description: They're soft yet scratchy and there are two of them. Remind you of anything?

name: Kralahat
description: Warning: Contact with sensitive skins may cause hives. You should apply cream before use.

name: The Kralacape
description: Have you always dreamed of looking like an octopus? Now you can!

name: Mollusky Bow
description: If you don't know how to use this bow, you can always pretend it's a staff. Then again, only a real Iop doesn't know how to use a bow.

name: Defribulammer
description: If you manage to knock your target out with this hammer, whatever you do, don't hit it again! It might just come back to life, madder and badder than ever!

name: Electoocute
description: Awww, just look at this adorable little ring, with its little antennae and... BZZZT!

name: Fins
description: These epaulettes were fashioned out of fins removed from shark carcasses. Slap them on your shoulders and get ready to terrorize Sufokia!

name: Scalpachii
description: Leave the teeth included with this helmet as blunt as possible. Your head will thank you for it.

name: The Sharkape
description: With this cape, you can play the old 'shark in the water' trick on the poor, unsuspecting tourists!

name: Selachiidrilles
description: With these shoes on your feet, you'll look like an authentic crimebuster of the sea!

name: Selachii Ring
description: Tiny little shark, big sharp teeth.

name: The Conchus
description: Just remember: always let your Conchus be your guide!

name: Wounded Cloak
description: There must be at least fifty shades of blood on this cloak, from fruity Eniripsa blood to wood-scented Sadida blood, not forgetting a few healthy spatters of milky Pandawa blood.

name: Wounded Headgear
description: This hat's teeth are still very sharp, so file 'em down or watch your nose!

name: Wounded Ring
description: This is the ring the goddess Sacrier was offered for her hand in marriage. Obviously, she already had dozens like it, but it's the thought that counts.

name: Spear Selachii Spear
description: As sharp as a sharp shark tooth.

name: Squalachii
description: Before Gobbowl was all the rage, whacking a Chafer's head with a Squalachii was a hit. This sport has since been removed from the official league of sports in Brakmar.

name: Saw Sword
description: Selachii Teeth are well-known for being able to saw through all types of wood. With this sword, you'll be a fighter-slash-lumberjack par excellence!

name: The Fiscalachii
description: This is great for those who want to look after their hard-earned kamas. Finally, a shield made for the well-off!

name: Sharksies
description: A cutesy-wutesy name for a pair of cutesy-wutesy... enormous... intimidating epaulettes. Gulp!

name: Selachii Pecs
description: You may not have known that they had pecs, but now that you do know, do you not agree that they must be among the toughest in the World?

name: Blood-Drenched Cards
description: The messiest cards ever. Period.

name: Shingle Shield
description: Thanksh to all the sheaweed inshide thish shield, not a shingle bullet will shucsheed in reaching you.

name: Whirly Resin
description: Euphoric resin! If you eat it, it'll really make your head spin!

name: Whirloin Steak
description: Manners cost nothing...

name: Coagulated Blood
description: Black, nauseating blood. Really, what are you going to do with that?

name: Chains
description: Chains covered in coagulated blood...

name: Hair Tuft
description: A tuft of red hair torn from a victim.

name: Patched Fabric
description: A piece of worn and patched fabric.

name: Tattooing Ink
description: Ink for Sacriers' tattoos... Some say that it's magic.

name: Blood-Drenched Axe
description: Ecaflips avoid this axe because they hate running out of veins.

name: Scarnicarf
description: Wounds, fractures, broken bones... this scarf is useful against all types of ills.

name: Borano Cane
description: When Borano healed, she was sarcastic, and was rather well-versed in the caustic arts.

name: Nemic Sheet
description: A cape for those who enjoy spilling blood and can't stop.

name: Raging Ring
description: Let the rage inside you boil!

name: Sixtooth Ring
description: A ring that's perfect for those who are missing a few toothy-pegs.

name: Frenzied Ring
description: Fury, frenzy, thirst for blood... That's what this ring will bring you...

name: Junc Tuous
description: A ring to nibble on for those who bite their nails. What's more, it tastes better.

name: Raging Epaulettes
description: With these epaulettes, no one will dare go looking for trouble with you, out of fear that you'll become red with rage.

name: Raging Amulet
description: Set with a ruby, this amulet looks like a red eye full of anger, staring at you.

name: Raging Belt
description: This belt, imbued with magic, makes its wearer surprisingly bloodthirsty.

name: Screeching Belt
description: This belt is tight. Far too tight.

name: Blood Cape
description: A high-ranking cape for an ordinarily-blooded Sacrier.

name: Canaveral Cape
description: This cape goes hand in hand with the "Space Tunic", a famous coat of mail that was launched on a rocket along with its creator, the equally famous Cap'tain Eddy.

name: Screechcut
description: Have you never screamed with fright at the thought of a blow-dry?

name: Frenzied Headgear
description: So you can go completely nuts...

name: Stunt Helmet
description: A perfect helmet for doing acrobatic forward rolls and landing next to your enemy without injuring yourself.

name: Erised Coat
description: A gash on your torso? Put on this coat with hints of acid for two days and you're sorted, minus a few superficial burns.

name: Frenzied Breastplate
description: You should always be wary of fighters who have nothing in terms of armor but a simple, bloodied piece of fabric.

name: Screeching Armor
description: To scream before a battle, you need a lot of puff. If you don't have enough, this armor may at least be useful as a resonance chamber.

name: Frenzied Boots
description: These boots make you want to hit everything that moves.

name: Olasrate Shoes
description: Dearest...

name: Hemocassins
description: To walk the path of the greatest Sacriers, you need to get your shoes dirty first.

name: Bloody Dagger
description: Red with blood, but clean of any suspicion, Redith Splaf saw life through rose-tinted glasses thanks to this cursed dagger.

name: Schnek Mask
description: It might crush your skull, but you got it from the Schneks - what did you expect?

name: Schnek Tail
description: This spongy cloak will stick to your skin like proverbial feces to a blanket.

name: Schnek Bracelet
description: This elastic bracelet will fit around any wrist... even yours!

name: Schnek Knee Pads
description: You needn't worry about getting attacked with these knee pads on - they're squidgy enough to cushion the blow.

name: Garter Belt
description: This belt will hold in all that excess weight!

name: Schnek Ring
description: This ring is so elastic it will adapt its size to any finger you choose to wear it on.

name: The Amuschnek
description: Even if you lose a bit of it, it'll grow back.

name: Schnek Tank Top
description: This seductive top will protect you from rubbing against the ground.

name: Queen Schnek Epaulettes
description: They were once worn gracefully.

name: Queen Schnek Shawl
description: It keeps you warm and makes you much more elegant when you move.

name: Renegade Boots
description: Run, not gait!

name: Daggappalling
description: It really is appalling...

name: Worn Thongs
description: We're not in Sufokia any more. Here, you don't ride your Dragoturkeys while wearing thongs.

name: Aged Belt
description: It's a bit old, but is still interesting indeed.

name: Prisoner Protector
description: You deserve a break, so why not just hide behind this schnexy schield...?

name: Chain Bracelet
description: Now you're handcuffed. But that doesn't mean you can't still fight with your feet... or your head.

name: Wormy Whip
description: Whip this out and watch your adversaries squirm!

name: Blood-Drenched Axe
description: Ecaflips avoid this axe because they hate running out of veins.

description: Wounds, fractures, broken bones... this scarf is useful against all types of ills.

name: Aged Belt

name: Mother-of-Pearl
description: Position this shard correctly to create a double rainbow, all the way across the sky.

name: Mussel Shell
description: An empty shell which smells of old mussels. Nice...

name: Fresh Mussel
description: Mussels like this one are delicious with fries. Good luck getting enough of them for a meal though - you'll have to battle a whole horde of Molluskies!

name: Kralove Heart
description: Has anyone ever told you that you have the heart of a Kralove?

name: Deadly Horn
description: Once removed from the Kralaboss, this horn should behave itself... Still, as they say, never trust a sleeping Mollusky.

name: Selachii Skin
description: Selachii Skin is known for being very thick. Unfortunately, it's also very greasy, very heavy and very slippery.

name: Selachii Blood
description: Tests are underway to investigate whether this blood came from a Selachii or from one of its victims.

name: Selachii Steak
description: For healthy jaws.

name: Wounded Fin
description: You thought this would be a great way to become "the funny guy" at beach parties; all it really does is turn off light switches when you're least expecting it.

description: Tiny little shark, big sharp teeth.

name: Selachiidrilles
description: With these shoes on your feet, you'll look like an authentic crimebuster of the sea!

name: The Conchus
description: Just remember: always let your Conchus be your guide!

name: Spear Selachii Spear
description: As sharp as a sharp shark tooth.

name: Squalachii
description: Before Gobbowl was all the rage, whacking a Chafer's head with a Squalachii was a hit. This sport has since been removed from the official league of sports in Brakmar.

name: Wounded Cloak
description: There must be at least fifty shades of blood on this cloak, from fruity Eniripsa blood to wood-scented Sadida blood, not forgetting a few healthy spatters of milky Pandawa blood.

name: Wounded Headgear
description: This hat's teeth are still very sharp, so file 'em down or watch your nose!

name: Wounded Ring
description: This is the ring the goddess Sacrier was offered for her hand in marriage. Obviously, she already had dozens like it, but it's the thought that counts.

name: Saw Sword
description: Selachii Teeth are well-known for being able to saw through all types of wood. With this sword, you'll be a fighter-slash-lumberjack par excellence!XXX

name: The Fiscalachii
description: This is great for those who want to look after their hard-earned kamas. Finally, a shield made for the well-off!

name: Sharksies
description: A cutesy-wutesy name for a pair of cutesy-wutesy... enormous... intimidating epaulettes. Gulp!

name: Whirly Helmet
description: You're finally ready to fight like a true soldier. Crawl Out! Erm, I mean FALL out!

name: Whirly Boots
description: Hard on the outside, their inside is lightly quilted with a soft lining that will tickle your toes while you're kicking butt.

name: Whirly Epaulettes
description: Why not take these on a whirl with your friends?

name: The Helices
description: Once they've been planted into their victim, these daggers continue to turn, just to carve as much meat as possible off their prey.

name: Whirly Helmet
description: You're finally ready to fight like a true soldier. Crawl Out! Erm, I mean FALL out!

name: Whirly Boots
description: Hard on the outside, their inside is lightly quilted with a soft lining that will tickle your toes while you're kicking butt.

name: Whirly Epaulettes
description: Why not take these on a whirl with your friends?

name: Whirly Breastplate
description: This breastplate, which is supposed to protect the front of your body, was, in fact, made with a Whirly's backside, which is softer and more elastic.

name: The Helices
description: Once they've been planted into their victim, these daggers continue to turn, just to carve as much meat as possible off their prey.

name: Whirly Cards
description: These cards look so pretty and whimsical when you drop them from a height that some people refuse to play anything but 52-Card Pickup with them.

name: Whirlihog
description: It makes you feel like sleeping...

name: Silmawhirly Cape
description: This cloak was most welcome in places like an island that the world has forgotten, where the heat was unbearable for much of the year. Twirl gently near the sunbathers and they'll be eternally grateful.

name: Silmawhirly Breastplate
description: When the whirl is not enough... try going Royal.

name: Silmawhirly Ring
description: Apparently, anyone who puts this ring on will have the magical power to twirl gracefully down from a tree to the ground. It used to belong to a Sram, but its powers left him in pieces.

name: Whirly Sword
description: Finally, ten years of baton twirling classes will pay off!

name: Whirlwand
description: When used, this wand glimmers and glows with powers called forth from the swirling mists of time!

name: Whirly Belt
description: With this belt around your hips, you can twist and shout all night long! Why not change your name to Russell? Go wild!

name: Imperial Whirly Boots
description: Goodbye, being turned away at the door for informal footwear; hello, Bilbiza's trendiest clubs!

name: Imperial Whirly Cloak
description: This cloak sparkles and shines all over to make you the most questionably dressed belle at the ball.  Grab a shiny breastplate and a golden amulet and you'll look even better than the Kwismas tree!

name: Imperial Whirly Ring
description: Who knew the head of the Whirlies was such a fan of jewelry? This ring glints subtly as he twirls in and out of rooms at swanky parties.

name: Whirly Helmet
description: You're finally ready to fight like a true soldier. Crawl Out! Erm, I mean FALL out!

name: Whirly Boots
description: Hard on the outside, their inside is lightly quilted with a soft lining that will tickle your toes while you're kicking butt.

name: Whirly Epaulettes
description: Why not take these on a whirl with your friends?

name: Whirly Breastplate
description: This breastplate, which is supposed to protect the front of your body, was, in fact, made with a Whirly's backside, which is softer and more elastic.

name: The Helices
description: Once they've been planted into their victim, these daggers continue to turn, just to carve as much meat as possible off their prey.

name: Whirly Cards
description: These cards look so pretty and whimsical when you drop them from a height that some people refuse to play anything but 52-Card Pickup with them.

name: Whirlihog
description: It makes you feel like sleeping...

name: Silmawhirly Cape
description: This cloak was most welcome in places like an island that the world has forgotten, where the heat was unbearable for much of the year. Twirl gently near the sunbathers and they'll be eternally grateful.

name: Silmawhirly Breastplate
description: When the whirl is not enough... try going Royal.

name: Silmawhirly Boots
description: These shoes are so light and comfortable that the participants of Prancing on Ice swear by them!

name: Silmawhirlfriend
description: A lovely amulet to add to your collection!

name: Silmawhirly Ring
description: Apparently, anyone who puts this ring on will have the magical power to twirl gracefully down from a tree to the ground. It used to belong to a Sram, but its powers left him in pieces.

name: Silmawhirly Epaulettes
description: These epaulettes will keep you cool all day long - and let you play at being a helicopter! Wheee!

name: Whirly Sword
description: Finally, ten years of baton twirling classes will pay off!

name: Whirlwand
description: When used, this wand glimmers and glows with powers called forth from the swirling mists of time!

name: Whirly Belt
description: With this belt around your hips, you can twist and shout all night long! Why not change your name to Russell? Go wild!

name: Royal Whirly Crown
description: This helmet is covered in Whirly Seeds, which helps it fit snugly around heads of all shapes and sizes.

name: Plas'whirly
description: Such a whirly good time!

name: Businesswhirly Epaulettes
description: These epaulettes belonged to a rogue trader: Whirly Capone.

name: Imperial Whirly Wedding Ring
description: It's a... nice day for a... Whirly weddiiing! YEAH! You look more rock 'n' roll than Larsenus Wallace!

name: Drheller Leather
description: Supple and strong, the leather is of much higher quality than ordinary Gobball leather! You'd have to be as blind as a Drheller not to see the difference!

name: Drheller Tusk
description: This tooth is used by Enutrofs to protect their mineral veins. If you see one hanging on the wall of a mine, the message is clear: no drilling!

name: Drheller Heart
description: This Drheller has his hand on his heart. Or...  is that your heart?

name: Drheller Hairs
description: Who would have thought that the hair of an animal that likes to wallow in its own muck would be so silky?

name: Rascal Fang
description: This fang will pierce a neat hole in any kind of material, be it soft Kralove flesh or the dry skin on the bottom of an Enutrof's foot.

name: Drhellzerker Boots
description: These boots were fashioned out of Rascal Leather and are hardy companions for all types of terrain, from Brakmar's volcanic slopes to the muddy marshlands of Amakna!

name: Drhellzerker Epaulettes
description: The tufts on these epaulettes are supposed to represent the Drheller's sharp teeth... Or was it the horns? I can't remember. They hurt a lot, either way!

name: Drhellzerker Cape
description: This cloak will make sure you stay stylish as you paw the ground and charge your enemy like a wild beast.

name: Drhellzerker Ring
description: Rascal used to wear this ring as a bracelet when he was a newborn. He can't wear it any more, though, can he? He's a big boy now! Who's a big, bad Drheller?

name: Drhellic Helmet
description: This cute little crown fits you like a Drheller!

name: Drhellic Cape
description: With this cloak, you can prospect to your heart's content. It won't save you from underground rockfalls, though.

name: Drhellingtons
description: Golly galosh! These boots are just brimming with mischief!

name: Drhellic Epaulettes
description: These epaulettes are almost as solid as Drheller Tusks!

name: Drhellic Belt
description: This belt's hooks will prevent enemies from escaping your unending tomfoolery. Mwa ha ha ha!

name: Horned Amulet
description: This amulet is all twisted and mangled because it's been used so many times to force the locks on treasure chests.

name: The Drhellspic
description: They say the spines on this breastplate can be explained by the fusion of a Drheller and a Prespic... Nothing can get in the way of true love, eh?

name: Junior's Collar
description: This collar used to sit proudly around the neck of Ruel Stroud's Drheller. If the greedy Enutrof sees you with it, he'll hit you so hard with his shovel that you'll be seeing Tofus for weeks!

name: Lute Belt
description: At the crack of dawn, there's no sweeter sound than a lute ditty.

name: The Dream Drhell
description: This amulet was designed with sleepless Drhellers in mind. All you had to do was slip it around your beloved pet's neck for a peaceful, refreshing night!

name: Homely Sword
description: Ah, it's nice to calm and relaxed, tucked away from all the wars and the bloody battles, happy, unruffled, inoffensive...

name: Authority Hammer
description: A hammer for a real leader.

name: Rascal Tusk
description: The craftsman who made this weapon had to work for nine days and nine nights to turn a Rascal Tusk into a hand.

name: Rascal's Muzzle
description: The wearer of this bracelet should be very proud. It was originally intended as a muzzle for Rascal, and it was the only thing that stopped him from being a busy, dizzy, killing machine!

name: Chained Boots
description: Ch-ch-ch-ch-chained boots! Look out, you rock and roller! Maybe this is punishment for all the victims you've killed in your days...

name: Hairy Cloak
description: There's no denying it: This cloak has a very strong and extremely unpleasant odor. It's really just a blend of fur from various monsters.

name: Firedrhell Amulet
description: This amulet starts snuffling 30 seconds before night-time fire drills, which should give you time to put on your pajama bottoms and comb your hair before going outside.

name: Firedrhell Ring
description: Put your finger in the hole!

name: Gray XIII Epaulettes
description: This epaulettes belonged to your friend from another age: Gray XIII.

name: Gray XIII Belt
description: Even though it belonged to Gray XIII, this belt only has a single defense. Can't think why…

name: Drhellic Helmet
description: This cute little crown fits you like a Drheller!

name: Schnek Mucus
description: There are downsides to the life of a Trapper, but you've gotta do what you've gotta do...

name: Schnek Silk
description: Very silky…

name: Schnek Earth
description: A patch of half-digested earth, for those who are considering giving up life as an adventurer in order to settle down on a quiet little plot of land.

name: Queen Schnek Milk
description: Your only memory of a being who really, truly loved you.

name: Mistaken Boots
description: Writing the name of these boots incorrectly will make you look like a real Badgerox!

name: Furiox Boots
description: Badgerox hair and potanicloakery... geez!

name: Potanicloakery
description: Big sister of the Apothecloakery, the first copy of this cape was designed by the same leather dealer.

name: Baggy Ring
description: No, this isn't black panther hair decorating this ring, but Badgerox hair.

name: Hairpaulettes
description: The bad mood of Badgeroxes often makes them change their tactics. Like cleaning your weapon with these Hairpaulettes, once you've finished chopping opponents.

name: Spicy Epaulettes
description: Better not mess with them, otherwise things could quickly get spicy...

name: Torsehair
description: This breastplate has the unusual feature of hiding the fact that you're just as hairy even without it.

name: Furiox Torso
description: A clumsily tanned, simple leather, which won't stop your opponents' attacks. Then again, some people enjoy the pain.

name: Shavield
description: Armor made from Badgerox skin, from which all hair has been removed.

name: Tooth-Duster
description: A Badgerox Fang set into a ring, perfect for breaking people's teeth.

name: Hairy Handcuffs
description: Also comes in fuchsia pink.

name: Slimy Rockett Headgear
description: Slimy Rockett, who died during the siege of Fort Alimo, was a trapper who was well known for his commitments to his nation, but also for his hobby of stuffing Badgeroxes.

name: Furiox Helmet
description: If you're aggressive and violent, especially when tired, this helmet's for you.

name: Badgerox Scalp
description: What's the idea of putting this thing on your head!?

name: Archaic Pendant
description: A charm bringing together a fang and a tuft of Badgerox hair. We'll let you wonder what strange belief whoever made this pendant had.

name: Romel Amulet
description: Fermented Romel milk has powerful curing properties, even if it's only worn around the neck. Does that surprise you? It's got to be drunk to be believed.

name: Alt-Tabron
description: Badgerox chefs weren't lacking in ingenuity when they made this cape, seeing as it's just an apron that's taken a backseat.

name: Furiox Cape
description: MY CAPE! WHAT ABOUT MY CAPE!? IT'S NOT YOURS!

name: White Quilt
description: Made from silky white Badgerox hair, this cape always stays clean.

name: Sneaky Fang
description: Named for its ability to hit right where it hurts, this two-handed sword will prove to be highly effective, especially when your enemy doesn't suspect it.

name: Suture Dagger
description: A dagger with a very fine point, which, when used properly, allows very effective sutures to be performed...

name: Ring for Lyf
description: Although effective, the decoration of this jewel remains debatable.

name: Crox
description: Be careful: unlike the sandals of the same name, it's inadvisable to try and walk with this dagger on your feet.

name: Trapper Belt
description: Leather, teeth and hair: what makes the Trapper Belt great.

name: Bearlt
description: This belt is the model that is neither too loose nor too tight, used by the Beardger family.

name: Unknitting Needle
description: To knit or not to knit, that is the knitty-gritty of the question.

name: Honeyjumble
description: Enough to turn your enemies upside-down.

name: Mistaken Boots
description: Writing the name of these boots incorrectly will make you look like a real Badgerox!

name: Potanicloakery
description: Big sister of the Apothecloakery, the first copy of this cape was designed by the same leather dealer.

description: A charm bringing together a fang and a tuft of Badgerox hair. We'll let you wonder what strange belief whoever made this pendant had.

name: Alt-Tabron
description: Badgerox chefs weren't lacking in ingenuity when they made this cape, seeing as it's just an apron that's taken a backseat.

name: Alt-Tabron
description: Badgerox chefs weren't lacking in ingenuity when they made this cape, seeing as it's just an apron that's taken a backseat.

name: Alt-Tabron
description: Badgerox chefs weren't lacking in ingenuity when they made this cape, seeing as it's just an apron that's taken a backseat.

name: Sneaky Fang
description: Named for its ability to hit right where it hurts, this two-handed sword will prove to be highly effective, especially when your enemy doesn't suspect it.

name: Sneaky Fang
description: Named for its ability to hit right where it hurts, this two-handed sword will prove to be highly effective, especially when your enemy doesn't suspect it.

name: Suture Dagger
description: A dagger with a very fine point, which, when used properly, allows very effective sutures to be performed...

name: Suture Dagger
description: A dagger with a very fine point, which, when used properly, allows very effective sutures to be performed...

name: Hairy Handcuffs
description: Also comes in fuchsia pink.

name: Hairy Handcuffs
description: Also comes in fuchsia pink.

name: Furiox Helmet
description: If you're aggressive and violent, especially when tired, this helmet's for you.

name: Furiox Helmet
description: If you're aggressive and violent, especially when tired, this helmet's for you.

name: Furiox Torso
description: A clumsily tanned, simple leather, which won't stop your opponents' attacks. Then again, some people enjoy the pain.

name: Furiox Torso
description: A clumsily tanned, simple leather, which won't stop your opponents' attacks. Then again, some people enjoy the pain.

name: Furiox Boots
description: Badgerox hair and potanicloakery... geez!

name: Furiox Cape
description: MY CAPE! WHAT ABOUT MY CAPE!? IT'S NOT YOURS!

name: Spicy Epaulettes
description: Better not mess with them, otherwise things could quickly get spicy...

name: Spicy Epaulettes
description: Better not mess with them, otherwise things could quickly get spicy...

name: Unknitting Needle
description: To knit or not to knit, that is the knitty-gritty of the question.

name: Ring for Lyf
description: Although effective, the decoration of this jewel remains debatable.

name: Trapper Belt
description: Leather, teeth and hair: what makes the Trapper Belt great.

name: White Quilt
description: Made from silky white Badgerox hair, this cape always stays clean.

name: Honeyjumble
description: Enough to turn your enemies upside-down.

name: Honeyjumble
description: Enough to turn your enemies upside-down.

name: Bearlt
description: This belt is the model that is neither too loose nor too tight, used by the Beardger family.

name: Bearlt
description: This belt is the model that is neither too loose nor too tight, used by the Beardger family.

name: Romel Amulet
description: Fermented Romel milk has powerful curing properties, even if it's only worn around the neck. Does that surprise you? It's got to be drunk to be believed.

name: Romel Amulet
description: Fermented Romel milk has powerful curing properties, even if it's only worn around the neck. Does that surprise you? It's got to be drunk to be believed.

name: Crox
description: Be careful: unlike the sandals of the same name, it's inadvisable to try and walk with this dagger on your feet.

name: Shavield
description: Armor made from Badgerox skin, from which all hair has been removed.

name: Badgerox Scalp
description: What's the idea of putting this thing on your head!?

name: Badgerox Fang
description: A pointy and solid fang like this can be used to cut stone.

name: Badgerox Claw
description: Badgeroxes use these to dig their burrows and tear apart their prey. They can even slice open the most solid breastplates.

name: Badgerox Hair
description: This tuft of hair is as silky as it is smelly; it needs a good clean before you put it to use.

name: Badgerox Tail
description: The Badgerox Tail is highly appreciated for its rich and thick fur, which is used to make solid components.

name: Eye of Badgerox
description: This eye constantly glares at you, still animated by the rage of its former owner.

name: Nauseatring
description: It'd be nice to say something interesting about this ring, but unfortunately, it really is of no interest whatsoever.

name: Ammonia Ring
description: This ring, which gives off a toxic gas, must not be mistaken for the Ammoniac Ring, which is used to do the housework.

name: John Jack's Ring
description: Many colored vapors are strewn across Mount Zinit. We owe the name of the rose to John Jack.

name: Amulethernal
description: A pendant made from Ethernal Essence, which will stay with you your entire life.

name: Siroccolace
description: Made from a desert wind, this amulet keeps its wearer warm.

name: Gallunctuous
description: Wearing these epaulettes shows that great worth in combat is not incompatible with a smooth and creamy inside.

name: Chim-Chimneys
description: Have you had it up to the rafters with all of the smoke and soot? Then don't forget to sweep these ones.

name: Vocal Cord
description: This belt sometimes gives off noisy, unpleasant vapors. Wear it in the right place; in other words, not where you'd usually wear it.

name: Billon Belt
description: Wearing this belt, you feel, definitively, like a Grawn fisherman who lost his favorite fishhook trying to gather Cotton in Sufokia, and who has caught a cold because he forgot to put his jacket on.

name: Smoke Tabard
description: This ventral protection gives off smoke that bothers those around you; it causes harmful effects and can be addictive for the wearer. It is forbidden from being used in public areas.

name: Narjacket
description: Some versions of this jacket can be used by several people at the same time. If you can't all get in at once, you can always pass it around.

name: Boiling Boots
description: Worn at high temperature, these boots scald your feet, making your jump higher and run faster.

name: Minute Booboots
description: Invented by Otto Chef to cook mushrooms he found between his toes.

name: Hotpants
description: Heated thanks to Ashdragon's remains, these pants are some of the most comfortable, despite the risk of sweating in irritating places.

name: Bannerash
description: Crowned with such a magnificent piece of headgear, you'll be able to guide your team into combat while crying "rally to my white banner!".

name: Pot Hood
description: Most adventurers use a damp towel to filter nearby vapors. This hood's users prefer to filter fresh air.

name: Bubble Hat
description: This hat allows people who have their head in the clouds to step on the gas a little. Can also be used as underwear for the same effect. No, seriously.

name: Saunape
description: This 2-in-1 cape can also be used as a heated picnic blanket, so much so that you can cook various foods straight on it.

name: Caporette
description: A cloak that is less harmful than traditional cloaks, available in several flavors to choose from: Cawwot, Melon, Corn, etc.

name: Mam Drape
description: A large drape to keep you warm. Lots.

name: Amulet of Howlieng Wind
description: The Amulet of Howlieng Wind produces impressive energy in the presence of ambient winds and vapors. It is said that the power of its rotation is so strong that a curious Puddly could end up being scattered to the four corners of the World of Twelve if it came too close.

name: Hippie Pipe
description: Yay!

name: Vape Hammer
description: Twirl this weapon to engulf your opponent in a cloud of smoke.

name: Fogblade
description: The essential weapon to cut your way out of a thick, morning-after fog.

name: Daggasser
description: As fast as the wind, as quick as lightning, this dagger will strike down your opponent on the spot.

name: Peace Pipe
description: It is said that this pipe is a symbol of peace, but it could be simpler just to hit your enemies with it.

name: Heesh
description: Calmly smoke your enemies.

name: Panache Cloak
description: If you spot a moving column of smoke from afar, it's probably someone running with their Panache Cloak equipped.

name: Acid Breath
description: It's said that some careless trappers tried to harvest this breath without the proper protection, and were dissolved on the spot.

name: Rough Vapor
description: This gas leaves a bitter taste in the mouth, but that doesn't really matter since it wasn't made to be ingested.

name: Rancid Fragrance
description: This gas gives off a smell that makes your nose tingle. Be careful not to get poisoned.

name: Hot Ashes
description: This is all that remains of Ashdragon, after you snuffed out his flames.

name: Egg Head
description: This headgear's charm lies not in the fact that it makes you look bald, but more in the fact that you accept it.

name: Eggstplate
description: This breastplate was created by someone who wanted to be impenetrable, except on the inside.

name: Dreggon Boots
description: Despite the centuries, these ancestral boots haven't lost their main use: they're still great barbecue skewers.

name: Dreggon Cloak
description: Dreggons come together once a year for a style contest. The most ugly attire is thus abandoned, Which explains how you ended up wearing this cloak…

name: Egg Head
description: This headgear's charm lies not in the fact that it makes you look bald, but more in the fact that you accept it.

name: Eggstplate
description: This breastplate was created by someone who wanted to be impenetrable, except on the inside.

name: Dreggon Boots
description: Despite the centuries, these ancestral boots haven't lost their main use: they're still great barbecue skewers.

name: Eggband
description: An egg-squisite ring.

name: Dreggon Cloak
description: Dreggons come together once a year for a style contest. The most ugly attire is thus abandoned, Which explains how you ended up wearing this cloak…

name: Small Shell
description: Many knowledgeable people have tried to craft a material that is as solid as Dreggon Shells, but without much success, judging by this shield.

name: Horringble
description: This is the kind of accessory an ineffective Dregger can wear.

name: Egg Ring
description: The Dregger's aim is to slip it on your finger. Knowing this, are you still so sure you want to wear it?

name: Pocket Belt
description: No, not as in a belt that you can fit in your pocket, but a belt with many pockets. That's far more useful.

name: Poached Cloak
description: Breakfast, anyone?

name: Foot Ring
description: The Foot Ring isn't big enough for you to put both feet in it.

name: Necklayace
description: Learning is a lifelong experience. You're best starting as early as possible, because "lifelong" is indeed quite long.

name: Lasso
description: Leather Dealers have always been talented when it comes to finding unorthodox uses for items…

name: Nine Leggues Boots
description: These boots belonged to an Ogre who ate Dreggon children.

name: Plastrong
description: It really is quite strong.

name: Karma Epaulettes
description: Rub the left epaulette and an evil genie will torment you for all eternity; rub the right one and a good genie will make your greatest wish come true. Or is it the other way around?

name: Future Belt
description: A great responsibility weighs on those who have information before anyone else. Don't tell anyone what this belt does!

name: Dreggon Amulet
description: This amulet from the Dofus Era will make all the difference in combat by protecting you from a lack of ambition. And hits to the throat.

name: Egg Head
description: This headgear's charm lies not in the fact that it makes you look bald, but more in the fact that you accept it.

name: Foot Ring
description: The Foot Ring isn't big enough for you to put both feet in it.

name: Soft-Boiled Talisman
description: Its consistency will not reassure you as to its solidity.

name: Easandals
description: You'll feel easy wearing these.

name: Reinforced Shell
description: The inner membrane of this improvised breastplate makes it very comfortable for its wearer. You'll feel as clean as a newborn child at the end of the day.

name: Epaulettes Goh
description: Goh was a great leader among the Dreggons. That's what we think, at least.

name: Necklayace
description: Learning is a lifelong experience. You're best starting as early as possible, because "lifelong" is indeed quite long.

name: Lasso

name: Nine Leggues Boots
description: These boots belonged to an Ogre who ate Dreggon children.

name: Draconic Hood
description: Power, terror, fear… You inspire many things in those who lay their eyes upon you.

name: Exploded Ring
description: As bright as an exploding star.

name: Spewn
description: You can use it to fight off you enemies or to eat some wholesome soup.

name: Glove Dalf
description: It gets a little whiter with each death.

name: Glove Dalf
description: It gets a little whiter with each death.

name: Gon Door Hinge
description: Whose idea was it to install golden door hinges on a door? And whose even more absurd idea was it to steal one an use it as a ring?

name: Gon Door Hinge
description: Whose idea was it to install golden door hinges on a door? And whose even more absurd idea was it to steal one an use it as a ring?

name: Round Han
description: This ring was forged in the shape of a magnificent Dragoturkey. However, more than anything else, it's painful to wear.

name: Round Han
description: This ring was forged in the shape of a magnificent Dragoturkey. However, more than anything else, it's painful to wear.

description: This seal has no relation whatsoever to the animal.

name: Round Seal of Sor'Hon
description: This seal has no relation whatsoever to the animal.

name: Round Seal of Sor'Hon
description: This seal has no relation whatsoever to the animal.

name: Alfredon's Nightmare
description: A ring that you'd better not put on your finger, unless you want to have the scare of your life. At worst, you'd be better destroying it than keeping it, but that's no easy task!

name: Alfredon's Nightmare
description: A ring that you'd better not put on your finger, unless you want to have the scare of your life. At worst, you'd be better destroying it than keeping it, but that's no easy task!

name: Frequent Ring
description: This ring does not rule any others, much bad may it do them.

name: Frequent Ring
description: This ring does not rule any others, much bad may it do them.

name: Mail Har
description: Combine the Mail Har with the Val Har, and you'll get the Nurmiwings.

name: Mail Har
description: Combine the Mail Har with the Val Har, and you'll get the Nurmiwings.

name: Owin Girdle
description: Poor fool! No man can wear it!

name: Coat of Mythwil
description: A highly resistant, lightweight coat of mail. It seems strong enough to stop a lance blow from a Trool.

name: The Great Leaps to Ragorn
description: Legend has it that if you roam with these boots and you find a Gon Door Hinge, you're crowned king.

name: The Great Leaps to Ragorn
description: Legend has it that if you roam with these boots and you find a Gon Door Hinge, you're crowned king.

name: Meridia and Pippin
description: These two boots are inseparable, and will take you off the beaten paths.

description: These two boots are inseparable, and will take you off the beaten paths.

name: Slippantir
description: You don't need a vision stone to see it coming; you'd realize even with your eyes closed!

description: You don't need to have visions of the past, present, and future to recognize that you're going to love these stripes.

name: Borrow Myre Helm
description: I'd avoid this helmet if I were you... Rumor has it that whoever wears it generally suffers a quick death in atrocious suffering.

description: You risk getting sunstroke if you put this on...

description: This ancient cape has survived the ages thanks to its resistance and its unusual abilities.

description: A small, round amulet that inspires bravery. It's said that it was created by a gardener, which is why it's so effective at clearing the field. Side effects: cravings.

description: Following a grim story of dragons, Thiron tried to reconquer Elbor. In the end, he found nothing but this shield, which has never burned, despite its relatively hostile environment. Only the Twelve know how.

description: This plutonic rock is very hard, and its solid, grainy texture may be useful to you in much artisanal crafting.

name: Mahogany Wood
description: Hey mahogany, mahogany, mahogany... This wood instills in you the crazy desire to grab everyone around you and dance in unison. Hands out, behind your head...

name: Mahocurrent Wood
description: Use this wood if you want to really get connected.

name: Bramble Wood
description: This Bramble Wood is used a lot in shield manufacturing. The only drawback is that your enemies will tend to stick to it.

name: Tabas'KO Wood
description: This wood is so spicy that you'll need to drink lots of Gobbette Milk to reduce the pain. At the same time, it wasn't such a good idea to eat such spicy wood...

name: Blackberries
description: But mooom, all my friends have them!

name: Sweat Jute Fiber
description: This fiber is used in clothing of questionable taste. It’ll make you look like a potato sack, but hey, maybe that’s your thing!

name: Luminous Jute
description: People say that this Jute shines all night long and attracts Ghostofs.

name: Twisted Rump Chilli
description: Here's something that will transform the blandest of dishes into a taste sensation! An obligatory gastronomic test you'll have to pass if you want to live on a scorching hot island!

name: Momoss
description: When dried, Momoss is ideal for starting fires, which is just what you need for roasting a few Salamanders along the way.

name: Momoss Aka
description: Springy and tasty. Can be slept on or eaten.

name: Nettle Leaf
description: Chopped, marinated or made into a soup; nettle leaves are absolutely delicious. But watch out, they'll probably be the last thing you taste!

name: Blood-Drenched Nettle Leaf
description: It certainly looks like this Nettle Leaf was used by someone before you picked it.

name: Silver Ore
description: All that glitters is not Gold. All that glitters is not Gold. Sometimes there’s a Silver lining, though.

name: Shiny Silver Ore
description: It shines like crystal or diamond, but it's just silver.

name: Obsidian Ore
description: Legend has it that a miner was able to use this ore to access another dimension. But hey, we can't just listen to any old yarns...

name: Iridescent Obsidian
description: This obsidian is often used by Riktus bosses who want to give their den a bit of character.

name: Salamander
description: There were many Salamanders living in the Lava Cave. Now, it's no longer possible due to the climate there, which is too cold.

name: Albino Salamander
description: Albino Salamanders are highly prized by local Badgeroxes, so much so that some even believe them to be sacred.

name: Fish Bone
description: There's no more meat left on this fish. Maybe the bone is edible?

name: Poisoned Bone
description: To be cooked for a business dinner, so your opponent will be less inclined to drag out negotiations.

name: Pumpkininin
description: Something is lost, and something is created in its place; this Pumpkininin is living proof of this.

name: Chaos Chili
description:
This chili will create absolute chaos in your mouth.
Warning: sensitive taste buds should keep away.

name: Vessel Zinit Bed
description: A traditional Eliatrope Vessel bunk - basic but very comfortable - for nights spent among the stars.

name: Vessel Zinit Table
description: This table is sufficiently large for the most important discussions of the day.

name: Vessel Zinit Cupboard
description: No, this isn't a fridge, so don't go putting your Gobball Legs in there! Think about how awful they'd smell after a week…

name: Vessel Zinit Dresser
description: A beautiful and refined dresser, designed by the Eliatropes, perfect for a tidy, zen space.

name: Vessel Zinit Screen
description: While its transparency might not make it the most practical of screens, it's so Eliatrope that you just can't resist it!

name: Vessel Zinit Plant
description: If daily watering and dead leaves aren't your thing, why not enjoy one of these marvelous holographic plants instead?

name: Vessel Zinit Game
description: It's important to relax your body in a confined space like the vessel, so we recommend you open a few portals to stretch your arms and legs.

name: Vessel Zinit Altar
description: Your dearly departed are with you throughout your journey on this refined altar.

name: Pot-Bellied Gorsegoyle Berry
description: This Gorsegoyle Berry has a very pronounced, peppery flavor. Chefs should always have a few on hand for seasoning their dishes.

name: Exemplary Citronana Wood
description: All Citronanas should follow the example of this one.

name: Hallowed Pooplar Wood
description: Hallowed Pooplar Wood is fairly resistant and difficult to split.

name: Not Mushroom
description: This rare mushroom is prized by those who love spending time in the kitchen. That is, if you can get in there with Not Mushroom.

name: Carbon Hara
description: You can't heat it in a frying pan, but it goes well with Spaghettos nonetheless.

name: Buttfish
description: Does my buttfish look big in this?

name: Pond Boowolf
description: This Pond Boowolf grew up in a pond before leaving to conquer wider, purer waters.

name: Lembash Bread
description: Even if you're not normally a fan of foreign grub, this bread should please you in any case. It looks like a single mouthful would be enough to sustain a grown man for several days.

name: Marlhai Boabob Wood
description: This wood will stand up for its rights and won't give up the fight.

name: Wind Shield
description: This will help to keep inclement weather off you.

name: Chopping Maul
description: A very useful tool, it has everything you need.

name: Sitton Defense
description: The perfect shield for when you're deciding which side to fight for.

name: Lily Hammer
description: You can start a new life with this hammer.

name: Tropical Belt
description: Perfect for basking in the sun. However, dancing in it is not recommended because it barely covers anything!

name: Tropical Belt
description: Perfect for basking in the sun. However, dancing in it is not recommended because it barely covers anything!

name: Tropical Belt
description: Perfect for basking in the sun. However, dancing in it is not recommended because it barely covers anything!

description: With this shirt, temperatures will rise, but it won't get hotter, if you know what I mean!

name: Tropical Shirt
description: With this shirt, temperatures will rise, but it won't get hotter, if you know what I mean!

name: Tropical Epaulettes
description: Wearing these is the best way of avoiding sunburnt shoulders.

description: Sporting these sandals will give your enemies a sense of dread.

name: Despairdrilles
description: Sporting these sandals will give your enemies a sense of dread.

name: Troprickly Ring
description: This ring isn't very powerful, but it's so full of splinters that no one will steal it off you.

description: If only you'd realized earlier that you could fashion a useful hat from a Kokonut tree to protect your eyes from the sun, you would never have got lost on this wretched island in the first place.

description: Careful when you handle these, you don't want to feel a prick.

name: Sinuous Dagger

name: Soul Dagger
description: This dagger is soul crushing.

description: Try not to break this, but if you do, you can always patch it together with masking tape.

description: Perfect for dancing to the beat of the drum...

name: Fortified Fist
description: You can always know how old this tree ring is.

name: Slippyneedler
description: Make sure to hold it very tightly, or it will slip out of your hands.

name: The Cardashians
description: They say that these cards once had luscious black locks and were mad about another card player, the Vwest, whispering sweet nothings like... “Oh Kannye! Kannye! Wherefore art thou, Kannye? Deny thy father and refuse thy name; or if thou wilt not, be but sworn my love, and I'll no longer be a Capulet!” So nothing too serious.

name: The Croc'Odaille
description: A lightweight and easy-to-handle wand that makes precision work a breeze.

name: Slippyneedle

name: Fanged Cards

name: The Recssenette
description: Its hard-looking heart is as mighty as the power it wields. Handle with the utmost care.

description: Don’t be fooled by the enormous horn, this helmet is made to preserve your personal space, not for charging. Opponents won’t dare to come near you and your impressive horn.

name: Kannivore Ring

description: Here’s an intriguing Crocodyl egg... They say that it has astonishing properties and can heal serious injuries.

name: Worn Net
description: This old net was taken from a Crocodyl skin. Don't let someone else net it!

name: Dirty Loincloth
description: A very dirty loincloth that belonged to a Kanniball. Be careful not to get it mixed up with your own; adventurers have already died that way in the past.

name: Passing Boots

name: The Protigious
description: It's amazing what you can do with just a stick

description: This will help to protect you from particularly vicious blows.
